pullRequest.title: TSK-1199 Adapt alert handling to error handling and use global notification handler
pullRequest.bodyText:
Test for alert-component has been disabled, because it tested for the old model.
This should be fixed in the next step when reworking the visual part of the alert-component.

nodes.bodyText: can we replace the this. from the replacement?
we are not calling it alert anymore ;)
For what is ModuleWithProviders used for?

nodes.diffHunk: @@ -2,8 +2,9 @@ role="alert"> {{alert.type === 'success'? 'done': (alert.type === 'danger'? 'error' :alert.type)}} - {{alert.text}} +

nodes.bodyText: or are we doing this sometimes later?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -2,8 +2,9 @@ role="alert"> {{alert.type === 'success'? 'done': (alert.type === 'danger'? 'error' :alert.type)}} - {{alert.text}} +

nodes.bodyText: can you make this a constant within the component and not the model?
Can you remove this and all its usages?

Generally I don't like that we have the this reference within the template. This may lead to some confustion for less technical people.
What do you think of renaming e.g. this.workbasketId to workbasketId. Same applies for anything nested.
responseOwner.field can also be reduced to owner
If you agree on doing this don't forget to replace all the replacement keys within the calling replacement maps
Chi told us that this is pretty Oldschool. When we decide to refactor both toast and error notification with angular material this should not be  an issue.

We decided to not call this Alert anymore. What do you think of toast? That was your idea in one of our meetings.
Please do this everywhere. ;)
why are you testing two times? What is the difference between those two tests?

commit.message: TSK-1199 Adapt alert handling to error handling and use global notification handler
